05DC7998C0EC4D3FA603756C0B6F3935.description: Develop messages that use logical, emotional, and ethical appeals.

9B17AF1C706B45E28E98BD8231149ED5.description: Employ effective repetition, rhetorical questions, and delivery style to convey message to impact the audience.

CA89B603BC6A4EB7A4CF3D67AF90172E.description: Remain conscious of the audience and anticipate possible misconceptions  or objections.

B9EC4A1AFA6F41379157C13BF5508442.description: Incorporate craft techniques to engage and impact audience and convey messages.

DF794E91458A4C579DA22D04C4CA31F9.description: Analyze the speaker’s use of repetition, rhetorical questions, and delivery style to convey the message and impact the audience.

3F54F472385749B6AF4DA0A42990861B.description: Determine if the speaker develops well-organized messages that use logical, emotional, and ethical appeals.

559C2E2751E54F68A8CAEE0C690A0E77.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and  rhetoric, identifying any fallacies in reasoning or exaggerated or distorted  evidence.

211B16D1AD97484BA5F983EA73EB365C.description: Critique how a speaker addresses content and uses craft  techniques that stylistically and structurally inform, engage, and impact  audience and convey messages.

E5897AA1163944C48B57F8A45E3A18DA.description: Create visual and/or multimedia presentations, using a variety of media  forms to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence for diverse audiences.

CA7923CC6A364E8DA7680F8BC7DE2A60.description: Analyze how context influences the mode of communication used by the  presenter in a given situation.

0C54428ACD854D53B758368A135B3C41.description: Communicate information through strategic use of multiple  modalities and multimedia to enrich understanding when presenting  ideas and information.

B4C1B35DEB2E4B058EEB0FD6BC145AD9.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using standard English  when indicated or appropriate.

C9E1B566A2E94A26BAA8FD04F31A65F4.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding  plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

E6A0EF43DA354F628556461C85FB52BF.description: Distinguish between credible and non-credible sources of information.

6C7ACD4FAD234190BCCEAF72AD9174F0.description: Present information and findings from multiple authoritative sources;  assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question,  citing supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that  listeners can follow the line of reasoning, and the organization,  development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience,  and task.

03F1CC9CC25A4492936B44318DBAD867.description: Articulate ideas, claims, and perspectives in a logical  sequence using information, findings, and credible evidence from  sources.

1C5F757EA1B3449898B3824111E3F4F0.description: Utilize various modes of communication to present a clear, unique  interpretation of diverse perspectives.

70334238C3CF48CD99E784749D2662EC.description: Synthesize areas of agreement and disagreement including justification  for personal perspective; revise conclusions based on new evidence.

58E004D9FCED4854BD43A0D8D6F88A08.description: Engage in dialogue with peers and adults to explore meaning and  interaction of ideas, concepts, and elements of text, reflecting, constructing, and articulating new understandings.

CDAF3D453D8643A393496802E273B2D9.description: Develop, apply, and adjust reciprocal communication skills and  techniques with other students and adults.

BB02AFF55E1049CC88B1033A68BEABED.description: Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions  with diverse partners; build on the ideas of others and express own ideas  clearly and persuasively.

A68ADC34F5DE40869CB10934A3AACF2A.description: Gather information from print and multimedia sources to prepare for  discussions; draw on evidence that supports the topic, text, or issue being discussed; and develop logical interpretations of new findings.

DB5B15F4635F40AAB74D107B07CFBEE6.description: Interact with others to explore ideas and concepts,  communicate meaning, and develop logical interpretations through  collaborative conversations; build upon the ideas of others to clearly  express one’s own views while respecting diverse perspectives.

0BA68AD80F284183A636A0C6A2B40643.description: Write routinely and persevere in writing tasks over short and extended time frames, for a range of domain-specific tasks, and for a variety of purposes and audiences.

EEEF582779C4410CAB75F8A2AEEF9F7D.description: Write independently, legibly, and routinely for a  variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences over short and extended  time frames.

BE41106153D948E983E185C12921D854.description: Commas to separate adjacent, parallel structures

8586A25746AB4927BD7D40D1B7B4AD06.description: Colon to introduce a list or quotation

E4729FA19BEE40B79D7882242972A241.description: Semicolon or a conjunctive adverb to link two or more closely  related independent clauses

908388808156499FB8666A81D11F432E.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard  English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

6149233790AF4BF48B69447699905A25.description: Use noun, verb, adjectival, adverbial, participial, prepositional, and  absolute phrases and independent, dependent, noun, relative, and  adverbial clauses to convey specific meanings and add variety and  interest to writing

42352157954A411ABEA7A97CF09757C4.description: Use parallel structures to communicate similar ideas

8DCCA41B6100488A90D7DA2A74A591BA.description: Use independent, dependent, noun, relative, and adverbial phrases and clauses to convey shades of meaning and variety

2E74EE1905C8427980F17C819C80F308.description: Use verb, noun, prepositional, and verbal phrases to communicate different meanings

98AB13C066024EEE8B10460274347E74.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard  English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

3A01796CEA424C27921478EDE14E8F90.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is  experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative

F82D55C6A33C441ABA5A433858F56371.description: Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language  to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or  characters

C55861DB07D34309B20A46B74B5F30E5.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,  editing, rewriting

0DFD4906B1024D4A8633BAC17C9A05B5.description: Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on  one another to create a coherent whole

FCE98552A2B149E58AF93987B9431380.description: Use narrative techniques of dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines to develop experiences, events, and/or  characters

E6046829D7354EA599FA880A981ABDBA.description: Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or  observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and  introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression  of experiences or events

805A4570B2C5465FB453C91A1D53F7CD.description: Develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective  techniques, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences

A6C08611A0614319B5C3E9A9E4FDFD58.description: Gather ideas from texts, multimedia, and personal experience to write  narratives that:

E323DDBB6649448DB28E98ED17EB3A82.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences  or events using effective techniques, well-chosen details, and well structured event sequences.

C10E5FFB1F244665AFD54FB6383E1F39.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and  supports the information or explanation presented

A089C6E278A34152AFBA623FC20F7453.description: Establish and maintain a consistent style and objective tone while  attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline

A4D42BD0AC7A4DD19DF2A4BED86F140C.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the  complexity of the topic

BF567FA0E2DB47CA80AA84C97242FB09.description: Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of  the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among  complex ideas and concepts

18322BEEDF3344029C7B9EBD8FEAAB7B.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,  editing, rewriting

8B527A58AA4D41EFA4BF77C3CC0B28DE.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while  avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation

04C318A3962D4C3AAE72228932A06276.description: Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts,  extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other  information and examples appropriate to the audience’s knowledge  of the topic

44116BBEE382493CB0BCF11829E4F233.description: Include formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension  as needed

3989C8E2CEB3448785A25BD29BC3C91B.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

6DE99E967CEC4F63BD52861D56D2B232.description: Organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make  connections and distinctions

7E05FA9E0E1543108C81A7B90DEA818E.description: Use relevant information from multiple print and multimedia sources

0DAF339DDBBB4B4B942F4C8DDD64F152.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey  complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

2803B8D320E24C32AB56B80F8DF68B5F.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and  supports the argument presented

E4B6B2D118F747DCB3EC8AB22D65DA88.description: Avoid logical fallacies and demonstrate an understanding of  objectivity and subjectivity

BF16856DA8F94EF08377222B1360CA41.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while  avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation

F08CD8B1FA664405B1F092A5D373258C.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising,  editing, rewriting

79AD672B9703409DA0517F6CCEC079FB.description: Develop the claim and counterclaims ethically without bias,  providing credible evidence and accurate interpretation of data for  each while delineating the strengths and limitations of the claim and  counterclaims

33A370A1B31D4146AD66CD997D0E0C7B.description: Use an organizational structure that logically sequences and  establishes clear relationships among claims, counterclaims, reasons,  warrants, and evidence

75787AA695A1419B92A0FF61FEEE7BFD.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source

F9579A2B07334A7B92E7A584F5D38D57.description: Use relevant information from multiple print and multimedia sources

3EF4CB7049E04D22994F61CD52AAAD4F.description: Introduce a precise claim and differentiate between the claim and  counterclaims

BAFDFF8EAB5F481CBE29798CA951DBDD.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and  relevant evidence.

9F8C5E9148FE4DE7B17B3AA0099F815E.description: Read and respond to grade-level text to become self-directed, critical  readers and thinkers.

B15FFD33C9D04625B713989DF24290F4.description: Read independently for a sustained period of time.

3A0F01C9497C499A8D6792E4D191B451.description: Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and  understanding.

209956569FFC454EA6DFCBD8036E5F31.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for  the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and  building stamina; reflect on and respond to increasingly complex text  over time.

9880C78516E642A8B2417110BFFE34C8.description: Analyze and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text,  assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and  sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning.

62FDFFAB91D546488F48DD001CA81A9A.description: Analyze in detail how the author’s ideas or claims are supported through  the use of text features and structures.

EF5A8CB2E51E4E4D8DF9BD661529E941.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in  print and multimedia texts to craft informational and argument writing.

735B7AB2CEAA4C9AA9835095749CAF9C.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze  how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

7E2E0C0E1D3B47C5BA26D06F0B0276D8.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice  of purpose and perspective shapes content, meaning, and style.

8AC7371BE201402F8D11AD401FEBC9A5.description: Use context clues to determine meanings of words and phrases.

1FC06D41495E4E2384BE1D59E2E7DEE2.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine the meaning of  known, unknown, and multiple meaning words, phrases, and jargon;  acquire and use general academic and domain-specific vocabulary.

E6EC88B4437C49B2A3A76A1AFA45F146.description: Explain how the author’s meaning and tone are developed and refined by text features and structures.

94451A5ED06241AF9FB67290709C89C5.description: Determine figurative, connotative, or technical meanings of words and  phrases; analyze the cumulative impact of specific words, phrases on  meaning and tone.

6692A40708EA4420AB499FFB7A07996F.description: Interpret and analyze the author’s use of words, phrases,  text features, conventions, and structures, and how their relationships  shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

6142305CBA6E48BC832D0F60BEAB4332.description: Explain how the use of different mediums, modalities, or formats impacts the reader’s understanding of events, topics, concepts, and ideas in  argument or informative texts.

19E5B789881D4D10BF1DA337B922C754.description: Research events, topics, ideas, or concepts through multiple  media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic modalities.

4BCF0966B93C47DEAAAA24A92BA6C3FF.description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the  course of the text including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by  specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

1BA1A8357CC34E95B5AB49C0E7EFCB75.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of  central ideas.

E5E727B2610641D8B2CE9933B08F2EB3.description: Cite significant textual evidence in order to articulate explicit meanings  and meanings that can be inferred from the text; identify multiple  supported interpretations.

EE850CF2027144D1B0F9E3E9A8B3D960.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by  making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing,  synthesizing, providing evidence and investigating multiple  interpretations.

2C575F2E62174E0084BD63F36D21647A.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support  comprehension.

F00189F59DF94BCBB67E7B6E5B7A1520.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis  skills in decoding words.

D9D1F0E43E3D4C4189758A4EC69E6BA1.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and  sounds.

79F7DE540525494D81735910A8EE2D8D.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic  features of print.

32960A0459D942718DFECAE95A9189FE.description: Read and respond to grade level text to become self-directed, critical  readers and thinkers.

E1283C83AE564B688DD044182871FA7C.description: Read independently for sustained periods of time to build stamina.

7923B0BD10A64871BC4AD78868128F91.description: Engage in whole and small group reading with purpose and  understanding.

A4AB189451C74D6CBB08A76E8014B3D5.description: Read independently and comprehend a variety of texts for  the purposes of reading for enjoyment, acquiring new learning, and  building stamina; reflect on and respond to increasingly complex text  over time.

2E085767CC9F4FAF878613B0D4EBF064.description: Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure a text,  order events within the text, and manipulate time create different  effects.

5726030264A74396B3D0DEC7F9EA6E37.description: Analyze how the relationships among structure, plot, and manipulation  of time create the effects of mystery, tension, or surprise citing support  from the text.

E274883985154624AA7D9651CD71AC4B.description: Analyze and critique how the author uses structures in  print and multimedia texts to shape meaning and impact the reader.

A382FA96F2E54AC0B2B54031F104A525.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice of point of  view, perspective, and purpose shape content, meaning, and style.

66D1D60F39B04CBB984D9404F6323766.description: Analyze and provide evidence of how the author’s choice  of point of view, perspective, and purpose shape content, meaning, and  style.

A3A91605A6544D0EBFBE0837B62F0C66.description: Use context clues to determine meanings of words and phrases.

701B6D8C353F4DBFBA6478A84E30D7F2.description: Apply a range of strategies to determine and deepen the  meaning of known, unknown, and multiple-meaning words, phrases, and  jargon; acquire and use general academic and domain-specific  vocabulary.

FB55342087964FCCAABC62F5DC556815.description: Determine the figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases;  analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and  tone.

C9C811D6B202419CB4FF7F67EC80DF89.description: Interpret and analyze the author’s use of words, phrases,  and conventions, and how their relationships shape meaning and tone in print and multimedia texts.

CABCB30048D2438B9FAEFAC51BE31E3C.description: Analyze how characters or a series of ideas or events is introduced,  connected, and developed within a particular context.

A5144823D30D445DB669EC20C607ACC1.description: Analyze characters, settings, events, and ideas as they  develop and interact within a particular context.

EEFB98865CAA473FB6929597ADB48CB9.description: Explain how literary texts and related media allude to themes and  archetypes from historical and cultural traditions.

6A99AF1C7BEB4BD4925FF1678CB42816.description: Trace the development of a common theme across media, modality, and format.

D04ACE9E13E0481CA15FBCFA49421B13.description: Analyze the relationship among ideas, themes, or topics in  multiple media, formats, and in visual, auditory, and kinesthetic  modalities.

DDE5BA0CED444C2B9A866842A6B3B568.description: Determine a theme of a text and analyze its development over the course  of the text including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by  specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

EA6BAACD194C48AFAFC6A5748AB4BDA6.description: Summarize key details and ideas to support analysis of  thematic development.

29C3C15C3F17418D8FD95AF5D04F4B86.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the  text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text; identify  multiple supported interpretations.

B09B3631F0B04D9ABFCD9E7D5605DD93.description: Determine meaning and develop logical interpretations by  making predictions, inferring, drawing conclusions, analyzing,  synthesizing, providing evidence, and investigating multiple  interpretations.

1BC4A71D7ABE4CDD9DC1AC33BF681FD8.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support  comprehension.

4EA926DBC7B544158C168B22027EB3B5.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis  skills in decoding words.

CA09E4BBE3884092A2482EABB209D1BF.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and  sounds.

F0D3929831FE447299D8471162C928B6.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic  features of print.

7EE5D76ED24E49EC88B105A067A70BC9.description: Analyze the process to evaluate and revise plan and strategies; address  successes and misconceptions; and apply learning to future inquiry.

2403FF64E93443048279E553A7E473B6.description: Analyze and evaluate previous assumptions; test claims; predict  outcomes; and justify results to guide future action.

FB6F08C5B7FF4BA9A7642C1B6B7E7F61.description: Acknowledge and consider individual and collective thinking; use  feedback to guide the inquiry process.

808379A31B2F4C34B243736111BA4AB6.description: Reflect throughout the inquiry process to assess  metacognition, broaden understanding, and guide actions, both  individually and collaboratively.

47D161AA5AFA4E0D93C688A5C9FF53AD.description: Determine appropriate disciplinary tools to communicate findings and/or  take informed action.

9E2535E8D9084C81A2DAEA71CEFA7220.description: Evaluate findings; address conflicting information; identify  misconceptions; and revise.

40B4A8A1D6D5470487F626006F91C37D.description: Employ a critical stance to analyze relationships and patterns of evidence  to confirm conclusions.

FD7C5A979DB5449BAE83D046FCAADA4E.description: Synthesize information to share learning and/or take action.

D529A65BE5C4415BBE1007D34A89BE99.description: Organize and categorize important information; synthesize relevant ideas  to build a deeper understanding; communicate new learning; identify  implications for future inquiry.

9943F61A5DC341689529FC7FCB00D227.description: Gather information from a variety of primary and secondary sources and  evaluate for perspective, validity, and bias.

A1F704C38917499E9A45FD6BA544BDA1.description: Examine historical, social, cultural, or political context to broaden  inquiry and create questions.

2BEB3F28546D42BD8FE88235F07438CC.description: Develop a plan of action by using appropriate discipline specific  strategies.

3B0EE46B5C9B4A85A5D504BE2F545356.description: Construct knowledge, applying disciplinary concepts and  tools, to build deeper understanding of the world through exploration,  collaboration, and analysis.

010E608F6B2D40BE9D7C87B7CE6903E0.description: Analyze ideas and information from text and multimedia by formulating  questions, proposing interpretations and explanations, and considering  alternative views and multiple perspectives.

EB7821E2B9D04819A0E85E6784935B9A.description: Transact with texts to formulate questions, propose  explanations, and consider alternative views and multiple perspectives.

560914317C884559B67D3ABD78BEDE7F.description: Use a recursive process to develop, refine, and evaluate questions to  broaden thinking on a specific idea that directs inquiry for new learning  and deeper understanding.

FD6E0FF76C5E4D3DB96E4703BF86AF9C.description: Formulate relevant, self-generated questions based on  interests and/or needs that can be investigated.
